sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都含有"提供，供给"之意。
means: equip ： 侧重提供与技术有关的装备或设备等。
furnish ： 多指添置家具等供给生活的必需品或为生活舒适提供所需的服务设施。
supply ： 普通用词，指提供任何所需求的东西。
provide与supply近义，但强调人的深谋远虑，侧重用贮备等方法作充分准备。
afford ： 一般只用于对抽象事物提供，也可指经济能力上的供给或支付。

sentence.Network_en: They could not afford to spoil those maps by careless colouring.
sentence.Network_cn: 若是上色的时候不小心弄坏了那些地图，他们可承担不起。

sentence.Network_en: They pay full rates. Mind you, they can afford it.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们付全价，请注意，他们是付得起的。

sentence.Network_en: It would be nice to be able to afford to retire earlier.
sentence.Network_cn: 无后顾之忧而能提早退休当是件幸事。

经济型酒店一般是指以大众可以支付的价格（affordable price）为顾客提供专业化服务的酒店。经济型酒店管理定位于普通消费大众…

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Old English  geforthian, from ge- (prefix implying completeness) + forthian 'to further', from forthThe original sense was 'promote, perform, accomplish', later 'manage, be in a position to do'

entry.def: If you cannot afford something, you do not have enough money to pay for it.

example.ex: My parents can't even afford a new refrigerator...
example.tran: 我父母甚至买不起一台新冰箱。

example.ex: The arts should be available to more people at prices they can afford...
example.tran: 艺术品应该以人们能够承受的价格面向更多的人出售。

entry.def: If you say that you cannot afford to do something or allow it to happen, you mean that you must not do it or must prevent it from happening because it would be harmful or embarrassing to you.

example.ex: The country could not afford the luxury of an election.
example.tran: 该国负担不起选举这样奢侈的事。

entry.def: If someone or something affords you an opportunity or protection, they give it to you.

example.ex: This affords us the opportunity to ask questions about how the systems might change...
example.tran: 这给我们提供了就系统可能如何改变进行提问的机会。

example.ex: It was a cold room, but it afforded a fine view of the Old City.
example.tran: 这房间虽然很冷，但是它能让人将古城的景致尽收眼底。

means.word_mean: 1. be able to spare or give up;

sentences.sentence: "I can't afford to spend two hours with this person"

means.word_mean: 2. be the cause or source of;

sentences.sentence: "He gave me a lot of trouble"

means.word_mean: 3. have the financial means to do something or buy something;

sentences.sentence: "We can't afford to send our children to college"
"The French doors give onto a terrace"

auth_sentence.content: Most villagers cannot even afford the bus fare.
auth_sentence.res_content: Most villagers cannot even afford the bus fare.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Most villagers cannot even afford the bus fare.

auth_sentence.content: We cannot afford to see another child die.
auth_sentence.res_content: We cannot afford to see another child die.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We cannot afford to see another child die.

auth_sentence.content: He probably couldn't afford to live anyplace else.
auth_sentence.res_content: He probably couldn't afford to live anyplace else.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He probably couldn't afford to live anyplace else.

Sentence.sentence: Politicians who thoughtlessly promoted home-ownership for those who could not afford it?
Rather, with incomes decreasing and insecure jobs, unhappy couples often couldn't afford to divorce.
Well, I guess I'd sell my watch or computer or do some odd jobs till I could afford a return plane ticket.
She was astonished by the professional possibilities afforded to young American woman.
He cannot afford to have a coffee break.
They cannot afford the time and expenses of rearing children.

sentences.en: She cannot afford a new dress.
We can ill afford the time.

jushi.english: Can you afford ￡1500 for a house?
jushi.chinese: 你拿得出1500英镑买一幢房子吗?

jushi.english: We can afford the TV set if we save our money.
jushi.chinese: 如果我们能积攒下钱就可买下那台电视。
